article: The carpenter I hired to help me restore an old farmhouse had just finished a rough first day on the job. A flat tire made him _ an hour of work, his electric saw quit and now his ancient pickup truck refused to start, so I offered him a _ . While I drove him home, he sat in stony silence. On arriving, he invited me in to meet his family. As we walked together toward his house, he _ at a small tree by the front door, touching the branches with his hands. The moment he opened the door, he had amusing _ . His eyes lit up and he ran to his two small children _ and hugged them and gave his wife a kiss. After leaving the joyful family, I passed the tree and my _ got the better of me, so I asked, "Before we went in the house, _ did you stop by the tree?" "Oh, that's my trouble tree." he replied, "I know I can't _ having worries both on the job and in my life, but those _ don't belong in the house with my wife and children. I know I can _ one thing for sure, so every night before I walk into my home I hang them up on the tree." "Funny thing is," he _ , "when I come out in the morning to pick them up, there aren't nearly as _ as I remember putting up the night before."
